an6.18:1.2: Note the repetitive idiom macchika maccabandha, repeated below. Also note the syntax. BB has the more economical “killing fish and selling them”, but I think the repetitive vadhitva vadhitva is meant to emphasize the fact that he killed them himself.
an6.18:4.13: The syntax of this passage mirrors [mn93:18.70]() and [pli-tv-kd16:6.4.1](). In each case, _te hi nāma_ introduces a passage referring to events of the past, but framed with a future tense, where the future is from their point of view.
